Business_AssetObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Business_AssetObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Business_AssetObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Suspend_Asset_Depreciation_for_WWS_Data.description: The Asset one would like to suspend depreciation for.

validation.validation: The asset is part of a lease contract. You can't suspend depreciation on leased assets.
validation.description: The asset is part of a lease contract. You can't suspend depreciation on leased assets.

validation.validation: You can't suspend depreciation on an asset with a contract information.

Suspend_Asset_Depreciation_for_WWS_Data.description: Suspend depreciation on or after this date is required for ALL requests. The response will contain the ‘Suspend From Date’ from the latest suspend schedule.

validation.validation: Fiscal period must exist for the suspend from date

Suspend_Asset_Depreciation_for_WWS_Data.description: Suspend depreciation on or before this date is required for ALL requests. The response will contain the ‘Suspend To Date’ from the latest suspend schedule.

validation.validation: Fiscal period must exist for the suspend to date
Suspend To Date cannot be prior to Suspend From Date.
Suspend To Date cannot be after depreciation end date (contract end date).
Suspend To Date cannot be used if asset has no depreciation end date (contract end date)
Suspend To Date is required for assets related to a contract and if the asset is not contract-related, Suspend To Date should not be passed in the request.

Asset_BookObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Asset_BookObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Asset_BookObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Suspend_Asset_Depreciation_for_WWS_Data.description: The Asset Book(s) to record the asset depreciation.

description: Contains the items needed to suspend asset depreciation.

validation.validation: Suspend date is EARLIER than depreciation start date of an existing cost or useful life adjustment
Suspend date cannot be earlier than in service date or an existing resume date
In progress events for the asset need to be resolved before suspending the depreciation
Depreciation may not be suspended for an asset that has an invalid document status of Disposed, Out of Service or Removed
Discrete Composite Asset or Components of Non-Discrete Composite Asset cannot be suspended.
The book selected is not a configured book for this company
validation.description: The book selected is not a configured book for this company

validation.validation: Suspend date cannot be after last depreciation period end date
validation.description: Suspend date cannot be after last depreciation period end date

validation.validation: Suspend date cannot be prior to depreciation start date
validation.description: Suspend date cannot be prior to depreciation start date

validation.validation: You cannot suspend depreciation in an asset book that is already suspended.
validation.description: You cannot suspend depreciation in an asset book that is already suspended.

validation.validation: Depreciation has been posted or accounted for periods affected by suspend date
